name: SupportRossAndEwan
_source: speak;Ross;Here you are.|I finally tracked you down.
speak;Ross;Hey, Ewan.|Nice to meet you.|I've been looking for someone around my age.|Let's hang out sometime, OK?
speak;Ewan;Sure, but do we have to wait until “sometime”?|How about now?
speak;Ross;What are you saying?|We're in the middle of a battle!

speak;Ewan;The others are fighting well, so the two of us won't make much difference.|Besides, even though I just started using magic the other day, I'm pretty good.|If something does happen, we'll be OK.
speak;Ross;Well, I'm pretty confident in my skills, too.|But, you know-how to put this delicately- it's the matter of morale.
speak;Ewan;You certainly are dedicated.|That's a surprise.
speak;Ewan;Why don't you prove your dedication by answering this brainteaser?
speak;Ewan;Yes.|It'll be really fun to watch you struggling to come up with an answer.|Ha!
speak;Ross;Hey!|What's that supposed to mean?|Well, whatever.|Let's do it.
speak;Ewan;OK, here it is.|Ross, do you know what a balance is?
speak;Ross;Of course I do!|Who doesn't?|It's a type of scale with small plates on both sides to put weights.|When both sides are the same weight, it balances.|So that was the riddle?|Easy!
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha!|You're too funny!|No, that was just the setup for the brainteaser.|Here's the real question.|Assume there are 25 pebbles.
speak;Ewan;Yes, they're really small.|As small as peas.|They are all the same color and shape.|In this group, there's one pebble that's lighter than all the other pebbles.
speak;Ross;And I must tell you the way to find that pebble?
speak;Ewan;Of course not.|What kind of challenge is that?|The question is, how many times do you need to use the balance to find that one rock?
speak;Ross;How many times?|Uh...|It's not...24, is it?
speak;Ewan;What?!|Oh! Ha ha ha ha ha!|That's the first time I've heard that one!|I see.|So you were thinking that you'd measure the pebbles one by one!|That's great, Ross!|You're too funny!
speak;Ross;That's not a compliment, is it.|You think I'm an idiot!
speak;Ewan;That's not true.|Actually, it is.|Ha ha ha!|And did I mention how perceptive you are, too?
speak;Ross;Oh, you!|Just you wait!|I'll figure it out!|I just need some time to think about it.
speak;Ross;I have an answer for your brainteaser!
speak;Ewan;You must have worked really hard to figure that out!
speak;Ross;See!|See!|I told you I'd get it!|Fighting's not the only thing I'm good at.
speak;Ewan;However, that's not the correct answer.
speak;Ross;What do you mean?|I can't believe it!|Ugh!|If that's not the right answer, then what is?
speak;Ewan;You were close.|The right answer is three times.

speak;Ewan;The key is how many pebbles you put on the scales at first.|First, put eight rocks each on either side of the scale.|The side with the lighter rock will be higher than the other, right?|Or, if the sides are balanced, it means that the lighter rock is in the rest of the pile.|So that was one turn on the balance.|The rest is pretty easy to figure out.|Let's assume that the lighter rock was in the remaining pile of nine rocks...|Then you'd put three rocks on each side of the scale.|So that's the second turn.|If either side of the scale tips, then the rock is in one of those two piles.|If the scale is balanced, then the rock is one of the remaining three rocks.|So, now you've figured out which group of three pebbles has the lighter one.|What you do now is put one rock from this pile on each side of the scale.|Like before, if the scale tips to one side, the lighter pebble is on the scale.|If the scale is balanced, then the remaining pebble is the lighter one.|And that was the last turn on the scale.|Did you get all that?
speak;Ross;Huh?|Well, I think I got it...
speak;Ewan;What?!|I just explained it all very clearly.|You still don't get it?|That's really...
speak;Ewan;Um, nothing.|Forget it.|A ha ha ha ha!
speak;Ross;“A ha ha ha” what?|What do you mean “forget it”?
speak;Ewan;Anyway, it's been fun hanging out.|Let's get together again sometime, OK?
speak;Ross;It wasn't fun for me at all!|Hey!
speak;Ewan;That brainteaser was fun, huh?|Did you get it yet?
speak;Ross;I already told you I didn't have any fun!|If that's what you consider fun, you must have had a pretty bad childhood!
speak;Ewan;My sister and I were abandoned when I was really young, before I could even talk.|She became a dancer and raised me all on her own.|I'm really grateful for her.
speak;Ross;You were an orphan?|I-I'm sorry.|I had no idea.

speak;Ewan;How could you know?|Don't worry about it.|I don't even remember being abandoned.|And because of that, I got a chance to travel around, and meet lots of people.|Like you.|So, I'm not sad at all.
speak;Ross;I see...|Hey, I just had a great idea.|Let's be brothers?
speak;Ewan;Huh?!|Like blood brothers?|I'm really not into slicing myself up for people I just met.
speak;Ross;No, no, no.|Just, you know, brothers!|Now call me “Bro,” Bro!
speak;Ross;Say it like you mean it!|Oh, never mind.|It'll just sound forced.
speak;Ross;Well, just call me Ross for now.|But, you can consider me a brother from now on.
speak;Ewan;What do you mean by that?
speak;Ross;I mean that I will be a friend who you can rely on and trust completely.
speak;Ewan;That's very kind, considering I really haven't known you for very long.|But thank you. You're a nice guy, even if you're not very sharp.
speak;Ross;Hey!|No need to insult me!|A simple “Thanks, Bro” will be enough!
speak;Ewan;Ha ha ha ha ha.|You're so funny!|By the way, do you have a girlfriend?
speak;Ross;W-what!|Of course not!|Did you forget?|We're in the middle of a war right now!|I have to focus on that!
speak;Ross;What's that for?|How about you?|Do you have one?
speak;Ewan;I have a lot of them!
speak;Ross;What?!|A lot of them!|Oh well.|We're still pretty young.|Better to not get tied down.
speak;Ross;Don't talk like it's not your problem, too!
speak;Ewan;Hey, Ross. I think we're going to be friends for a long time.|In fact, I know it.
speak;Ross;OK.|Boy, you're such a laid-back guy...
